definitions.definition: Measured by or in proportion to value.
A piece of software that is used to detect, delete and or neutralize computer-based viruses.
Containing both aural and visual elements.
definitions.example: They put together a stunning audiovisual presentation, with movies and music as well as plenty of information.
av u got d@? — have you got that?

definitions.definition: A broad street, especially one bordered by trees.
A way or opening for entrance into a place; a passage by which a place may be reached; a way of approach or of exit.
The principal walk or approach to a house which is withdrawn from the road, especially, such approach bordered on each side by trees; any broad passageway thus bordered.
A method or means by which something may be accomplished.
definitions.example: There are several avenues by which we can approach this problem.

definitions.definition: (urban toponymy) A street, especially, in cities laid out in a grid pattern, one that is in a particular side of the city or that runs in a particular direction.
Constituting or relating to the average.
definitions.example: The average age of the participants was 18.5.

definitions.definition: Neither very good nor very bad; rated somewhere in the middle of all others in the same category.
definitions.example: I soon found I was only an average chess player.
The average family will not need the more expensive features of this product.

definitions.definition: Not outstanding, not good, banal; bad or poor.
The official system of weights used in the UK between 1856 and 1963. It had been the customary system in London since 1300.
The official system of weights used in the USA between 1866 and 1959.
